article: Ordinary people in Britain have more washing machines and cars than in 1946. They also have more fear of unemployment. While once the nation's heroes used to be _ or politicians, today they are more likely to be _ faces on television or in films. These are just some of the _ discovered in surveys by the Market Research Society. More than 3,000 people were _ and the results were compared with a _ survey in 1946. Many people are better off and women spend much less time in the _ looking after their families. Also people's 27 _ in clothing and entertainment have changed considerably. And despite the variety of _ food now available, a quarter of the people still prefer _ food they're used to for a long time.
